Tongan.text: Ko e hā 'oku 'ikai ke lava ai ke ma'u 'api 'a ha'a fafine Tonga?

English.text: Why aren't Tongan women allowed to own land?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā e fatongia 'o e Tu'i mo hono fale 'i he fakalele e fonua?

English.text: What is the role of the King in the country's government?

Tongan.text: Ko e ha 'oku kosi ai e lou 'ulu he hili ha me'a faka'eiki?

English.text: Why is hair cut after a funeral?

Tongan.text: Ko e ha 'oku kei 'aonga nai ai e lau mahina faka-Tonga he kuonga ni?

English.text: Why are the Tongan months still relevant nowadays?

Tongan.text: Ko e fahu 'oku fakalangilangi'i 'i he ngaahi katoanga lalahi 'a e Tonga. Ko hai 'oku totonu ke fahu?

English.text: The "fahu" is greatly honoured in most Tongan traditions. Who is one's true fahu?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā 'oku kehe ai 'a e lea 'oku ngāue'aki ki he Tu'i, kau Nōpele mei he tu'a?

English.text: Why is there a difference in speech when addressing the King, Nobles and commoners?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā hono fokotu'utu'u 'a e nofo'anga 'o e kau matāpule moe kau Nōpele 'i he taumafa kava?

English.text: What are the seating position of the Nobles and orators during the King's kava ceremony?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā 'a e founga hono tuku mai 'a e ngaahi tala 'o Tonga 'i ono 'aho?

English.text: What ways did Tongans use to pass down stories and legends of old before written records were introduced?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā 'a e anga 'oe nofo 'a fāmili 'i he fale fakatonga pea ko e hā ha ngaahi liliu 'i he nofo fakatonga 'i he 'aho ni?

English.text: What are the ways in which family life is structured in a traditional Tongan house, and how have these living arrangements and family dynamics changed in the modern day?

Tongan.text: Ko e hā 'a e fa kave'i koula 'a e Tonga? Fakamatala'i 'e nau 'uhinga takitaha.

English.text: What are the four pillars of Tongan life and can you explain what they each mean?
